3 Pelaku Kekerasan Seksual Anak di Calon Ibu Kota Baru Dibui 15 Tahun
01 Nov 2019, 09:56 by Andi Saputra, Tim detikcom
Penajam - Tiga kasus kekerasan seksual terhadap anak divonis masing-masing 15 tahun penjara oleh Pengadilan Negeri (PN) Penajam, Kabupaten Penajam Paser Utara, Kalimantan Timur. Putusan Pengadilan Negeri Penajam tersebut untuk kasus kekerasan seksual terhadap anak yang terjadi di Kecamatan Penajam, Babulu dan Kecamatan Sepaku.
"Benar ada putusan itu," kata Ketua PN Penajam, Anteng Supriyo saat dikonfirmasi detikcom, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Sementara itu, menurut Kepala Dinas Pemberdayaan Perempuan, Perlindungan Anak, Pengendalian Penduduk dan Keluarga Berencana (P3AP2KB) Rivana Noor menyatakan di wilayahnya ada 15 kasus anak selama 2019.
"Baru-baru ini tiga kasus kekerasan terhadap anak sudah putusan dengan masing-masing hukuman 15 tahun penjara, dan satu kasus masih proses sidang di Pengadilan Negeri Penajam," kata Noor sebagaimana dilansir Antara.
Kekerasan seksual terhadap anak di Kabupaten Penajam Paser Utara pada 2019, menurut dia, terdata sebanyak 15 kasus dan 17 kasus anak berhadapan dengan hukum.
"Kami lakukan pendampingan kasus kekerasan seksual terhadap anak sampai ke pengadilan, satu kasus saat ini masih proses sidang," ujar dia.
Kasus kekerasan seksual terhadap anak di wilayah Penajam Paser Utara lanjut ia, kemungkinan banyak terjadi namun tidak dilaporkan karena masih dianggap aib (tabu).
"Kami harus melakukan sosialisasi agar masyarakat mau melaporkan kasus kekerasan seksual terhadap anak. Untuk itu, kami bentuk Perlindungan Anak Terpadu Berbasis Masyarakat (PATBM)," ucap dia.
"Diprediksi masih banyak kasus kekerasan seksual terhadap anak di wilayah Penajam Paser Utara yang tidak dilaporkan, daripada yang dilaporkan," katanya.
Noor mengatakan, sosialisasi menyangkut kekerasan seksual terhadap anak dilakukan para relawan PATBM, sebab selama ini korban maupun keluarga korban malu untuk melaporkan kekerasan seksual terhadap anak.
Dengan adanya PATBM di setiap desa dan kelurahan itu diharapkan kasus kekerasan seksual terhadap anak yang belum terlaporkan dapat terungkap, karena diprediksi kasus kekerasan seksual terhadap anak masih banyak terjadi di Kabupaten Penajam Paser Utara.
Tujuan pembentukan PATBM sebagai upaya Dinas P3AP2KB Kabupaten Penajam Paser Utara menekan kekerasan terhadap anak di daerah itu.

3 Perpetrators of Child Sexual Violence in Prospective New Capital City Detained 15 Years
01 Nov 2019, 09:56 by Andi Saputra, Tim detikcom
Penajam - Three cases of sexual violence against children were sentenced to 15 years each imprisonment by the Penajam District Court (PN) of Penajam Paser Utara Regency, East Kalimantan. The decision of the District Court of Sharpeners was for cases of sexual violence against children that occurred in Penajam, Babulu and Sepaku Districts.
"There is indeed a verdict," said Chairman of PN Penajam, Anteng Supriyo when confirmed AFP on Friday (1/11/2019).
Meanwhile, according to the Head of the Office of Women's Empowerment, Child Protection, Population Control and Family Planning (P3AP2KB) Rivana Noor said in her area there were 15 cases of children during 2019.
"Recently three cases of violence against children have been ruled with 15 sentences each imprisonment, and one case is still in the process of hearing in the District Court Sharpeners," Noor said as reported by Antara.
Sexual violence against children in Penajam Paser Utara Regency in 2019, according to him, recorded as many as 15 cases and 17 cases of children dealing with the law.
"We are assisting cases of sexual violence against children up to the court, one case is currently still in the process of hearing," he said.
He continued cases of sexual violence against children in the North Penajam Paser region, but it was likely that many occurred but not reported because it was still considered a disgrace (taboo).
"We have to do socialization so that people want to report cases of sexual violence against children. For that, we form a Community-Based Integrated Child Protection (PATBM)," he said.
"It is predicted that there are still many cases of sexual violence against children in the North Penajam Paser region that are not reported, rather than those reported," he said.
Noor said, the socialization regarding sexual violence against children was carried out by PATBM volunteers, because so far the victim and the victim's family were embarrassed to report sexual violence against children.
With the existence of PATBM in each village and village it is expected that cases of sexual violence against children that have not been reported can be revealed, because it is predicted that cases of sexual violence against children still occur in the District of North Penajam Paser.
The purpose of establishing PATBM as an effort by the P3AP2KB Office in North Penajam Paser Regency to reduce violence against children in the area.
